metadata.title: USN-5596-1 -- Linux kernel (OEM) vulnerabilities
metadata.description: Asaf Modelevsky discovered that the Intel(R) 10GbE PCI Express (ixgbe) Ethernet driver for the Linux kernel performed insufficient control flow management. A local attacker could possibly use this to cause a denial of service. (CVE-2021-33061)  It was discovered that the framebuffer driver on the Linux kernel did not verify size limits when changing font or screen size, leading to an out-of- bounds write. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2021-33655)  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-5596-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  linux-headers-5.17.0-1016-oem - 5.17.0-1016.17 linux-modules-5.17.0-1016-oem - 5.17.0-1016.17 linux-oem-5.17-tools-5.17.0-1016 - 5.17.0-1016.17 linux-image-unsigned-5.17.0-1016-oem - 5.17.0-1016.17 linux-tools-5.17.0-1016-oem - 5.17.0-1016.17 linux-modules-iwlwifi-5.17.0-1016-oem - 5.17.0-1016.17 linux-oem-5.17-headers-5.17.0-1016 - 5.17.0-1016.17 linux-oem-5.17-tools-host - 5.17.0-1016.17 linux-buildinfo-5.17.0-1016-oem - 5.17.0-1016.17 linux-image-5.17.0-1016-oem - 5.17.0-1016.17 No subscription required  linux-image-oem-22.04 - 5.17.0.1016.15 linux-modules-iwlwifi-oem-22.04 - 5.17.0.1016.15 linux-tools-oem-22.04a - 5.17.0.1016.15 linux-image-oem-22.04a - 5.17.0.1016.15 linux-oem-22.04 - 5.17.0.1016.15 linux-oem-22.04a - 5.17.0.1016.15 linux-modules-iwlwifi-oem-22.04a - 5.17.0.1016.15 linux-headers-oem-22.04a - 5.17.0.1016.15 linux-tools-oem-22.04 - 5.17.0.1016.15 linux-headers-oem-22.04 - 5.17.0.1016.15 No subscription required
